docs.snippet: A lawmaker from Britain's opposition Labour party stirred a political row on Wednesday after describing U.S. drugmakers Pfizer as "rapists" in comments criticizing the government for its handling of a potential takeover of AstraZeneca....

docs.snippet: Ms. Cummings was a participant in a federal lawsuit that accused The New York Times of racial discrimination in hiring and promotional practices....
docs.lead_paragraph: Ms. Cummings was a participant in a federal lawsuit that accused The New York Times of racial discrimination in hiring and promotional practices.
docs.abstract: Judith Cummings, who was the first black woman to head a national news bureau for The New York Times, serving as chief correspondent in Los Angeles from 1985 to 1988, dies at age 68.

headline.main: Judith Cummings, Chief of a Bureau for The Times, Dies at 68
headline.print_headline: Judith Cummings, 68, Chief of a Bureau for The Times

docs.snippet: Last Christmas Eve, Ririko Saito and her 11-year-old daughter gathered some plastic bottles, pots and a kettle and made several trips to a nearby park to get water. Their utility had just turned off the tap after months of unpaid bills....
